results.adx_keywords: Pop and Rock Music;Harrison, George;Lennon, John;McCartney, Paul;Starr, Ringo;Beatles, The
results.title: The Beatles’ ‘Now and Then’: A Glimpse of Past Greatness
results.abstract: The “last” song with contributions from all four Beatles, made possible by new technology, finds its power in vulnerability and nostalgia.

media.caption: From left: Paul McCartney, John Lennon, George Harrison and Ringo Starr. “Now and Then” is billed as the band’s “last” song.

results.adx_keywords: Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Israel-Gaza War (2023- );Clinton, Hillary Rodham;Yarhi-Milo, Keren;Columbia University;Hamas;Israel
results.title: Student Protesters Walk Out of Hillary Clinton’s Class at Columbia
results.abstract: The action was in protest of what they had perceived as the school’s role in publicly shaming students who had signed a statement saying that “the Israeli extremist government” bore responsibility for the war.

media.caption: The demonstrators sat quietly in a common area in the International Affairs Building at Columbia University on Wednesday, protesting against the school.

results.adx_keywords: Politics and Government;Speeches and Statements;Women and Girls;Marriages;Birth Rates;Population;Economic Conditions and Trends;Xi Jinping;Communist Party of China;China
results.title: China’s Male Leaders Signal to Women That Their Place Is in the Home
results.abstract: The Communist Party’s solution to the country’s demographic crisis and a slowing economy is to push women back into traditional roles.

media.caption: Leaders of the Chinese Communist Party and the state, including Xi Jinping, attending the 13th National Women’s Congress in Beijing last month.

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Content Type: Personal Profile;Elderly;Renting and Leasing (Real Estate);San Francisco (Calif)
results.title: A Twist Ending Awaited Two Empty Nesters in San Francisco
results.abstract: As rental prices sagged in the Bay Area, a couple searched for the ideal two-bedroom apartment. When they found it, they had another big decision to make.

media.caption: Tony and Jan Massara in San Francisco, where they hoped to take advantage of a softening rental market. “The goal was, for once in our lives, let’s have some freedom,” Mr. Massara said.
media.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.title: Senators Plot to Unblock Military Promotions as Tuberville Draws G.O.P. Ire
results.abstract: Democrats were working to temporarily circumvent Senate rules to outmaneuver the Alabama Republican, and a group of senators in his own party signaled their patience had run out.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: Senator Tommy Tuberville of Alabama has refused to allow military nominations to advance even when leaders of his party publicly disavowed his efforts.

results.byline: By Michael Gold, Luke Broadwater and Grace Ashford
results.title: George Santos to Keep Seat After House Votes Not to Expel Him
results.abstract: A group of New York Republicans, eager to distance themselves from their embattled colleague, failed in their push to remove him from office.

media.caption: George Santos characterized the move to expel him as a politically motivated stunt that robbed him of his due-process rights.

results.byline: By Emily Cochrane and Jessica Jaglois
results.title: Former Memphis Officer Pleads Guilty to Federal Charges in Tyre Nichols’s Death
results.abstract: The ex-officer pleaded guilty to two felony counts, becoming the first to admit culpability in the fatal beating of Mr. Nichols. As part of a plea deal, he is also expected to cooperate with a state murder prosecution.
per_facet: Mills, Desmond Jr (Memphis, Tenn, Police Officer)

results.title: House Passes Aid Bill for Israel but Not for Ukraine
results.abstract: The Republican-led House approved $14.3 billion for Israel’s war with Hamas, tying the aid to spending cuts. The Senate plans to craft its own bill that will include aid for Ukraine and Gaza.

media.caption: Israeli armored vehicles on the border with the Gaza Strip on Tuesday. President Biden has requested $105 billion in aid for Israel and Ukraine, and other global crises.
media.copyright: Tamir Kalifa for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Israel-Gaza War (2023- );Terrorism;Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Rumors and Misinformation;War and Armed Conflicts;Katan, Hosam;Hamas;Syria
results.title: The Horrifying Images Are Real. But They’re Not From the Israel-Gaza War
results.abstract: Videos and photos of the conflict are competing with misappropriated depictions of unrelated tragedies, a cycle that experts say diminishes the experiences of victims past and present.

media.caption: Photographers in Sderot, Israel, overlooking the border with Gaza this week. Photos and videos taken out of context are a common form of misinformation online.
media.copyright: Tamir Kalifa for The New York Times

results.title: How a Campaign of Extremist Violence Is Pushing the West Bank to the Brink
results.abstract: Israeli settlers and Palestinians have been locked in a cycle of bloodshed for decades. But extremist settler attacks could send the conflict out of control.

media.caption: Mourners bury the body of Bilal Muhammad Saleh, a Palestinian man killed by a settler in the West Bank last Saturday.

results.title: Law Firms Warn Universities About Antisemitism on Campus
results.abstract: Two dozen major Wall Street firms sent a letter to top law schools to crack down on discrimination and harassment amid an escalation in incidents targeting Jewish students.

results.adx_keywords: Israel-Gaza War (2023- );Anti-Semitism;Jews and Judaism;Palestinians;Content Type: Personal Profile;Social Media;Tishby, Noa (1975- );Gadot, Gal (1985- );Hamas
results.title: An ‘Israel Explainer’ Makes Her Country’s Case in America
results.abstract: Once a celebrated actress in Israel, Noa Tishby has emerged as a leading pro-Israel voice on U.S. TV, on social media and in print.

media.caption: Noa Tishby moved to Los Angeles seeking an acting and singing career. Instead, she has become a dominant and provocative voice on a war being fought in the Middle East and also on television, social media, and American streets and college campuses.
media.copyright: Mark Abramson for The New York Times
